messages.subject: Re: [[Unschooling-dotcom] Religion and Homeschooling]
messages.msgSnippet: ditto! Kathy Houston, TX. ... ________________________________________________________________ YOU RE PAYING TOO MUCH FOR THE INTERNET! Juno now offers FREE
messages.messageBody:
ditto!
Kathy
Houston, TX.
On Wed, 01 Nov 2000 16:05:20 -0700 Janette <sjanette@...> writes:
>--------------8CD99E50CE26C0A95E26C36F
>Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
>Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
>
>Me too!
>Thank you Debra.
>J.
>
>Debra Caruso wrote:
>
>> I am not homeschooling for religious reasons.Although I respect
>others
>> who do
>> so.I joined this list because of unschooling.One of the biggest
>> reasons I have
>> not joined a support group in my area is because of very negative
>> experiences
>> with the Christian ones.I prefer to keep the focus on unschooling
>,and
>> not
>> someones religious beliefs.I enjoy meeting people of all
>> faiths,ideas,etc......Peace...Deb in Va
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> > ---------------------------------------------
>> > Attachment:
>> > MIME Type: multipart/alternative
>> > ---------------------------------------------
>> I came to this list because it seemed to be on the
>> generic side when it came to religion. When I first
>> decided to homeschool I knew it might be difficult to
>> find other American Indian homeschoolers. While I
>> respect others religious beliefs Im glad to be on a
>> list that I am not inundated with being told how wrong
>> I am for being a "purist" or "heathen radical" and
>> teaching my son the ways of our ancestors. It was
>> very upsetting for my son to be called a devil
>> worshipper by other school children.
>>
>> __________________________________________________
>> Do You Yahoo!?
>> >From homework help to love advice, Yahoo! Experts has your answer.
>> http://experts.yahoo.com/
>>
>>
>> eGroups Sponsor
>

>> Check it all out at: http://www.unschooling.com
>>

>> List owner: Unschooling-dotcom-owner@egroups.com

>>

>> " In the midst of winter,I found within me an invincible summer"
>> Albert Camus Icq number 87168064 We are courageous,we are brave,we
>are
>> the survivors......deb

>--------------8CD99E50CE26C0A95E26C36F

>
><!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
><HTML>
>Me too!
><BR>Thank you Debra.
><BR>J.
><P>Debra Caruso wrote:
><BLOCKQUOTE TYPE=CITE>
><TT>I am not homeschooling for religious reasons.Although
>I respect others who do</TT>
><BR><TT>so.I joined this list because of unschooling.One of the
>biggest
>reasons I have</TT>
><BR><TT>not joined a support group in my area is because of very
>negative
>experiences</TT>
><BR><TT>with the Christian ones.I prefer to keep the focus on
>unschooling
>,and not</TT>
><BR><TT>someones religious beliefs.I enjoy meeting people of all</TT>
><BR><TT>faiths,ideas,etc......Peace...Deb in Va</TT>
><BR> 
><BR> 
><BR> 
><BR> 
><BR> 
><P><TT>> ---------------------------------------------</TT>
><BR><TT>>      Attachment:</TT>
><BR><TT>>      MIME Type:
>multipart/alternative</TT>
><BR><TT>> ---------------------------------------------</TT>
><BR><TT>I came to this list because it seemed to be on the</TT>
><BR><TT>generic side when it came to religion.  When I first</TT>
><BR><TT>decided to homeschool I knew it might be difficult to</TT>
><BR><TT>find other American Indian homeschoolers.  While I</TT>
><BR><TT>respect others religious beliefs Im glad to be on a</TT>
><BR><TT>list that I am not inundated with being told how wrong</TT>
><BR><TT>I am for being a "purist" or "heathen radical" and</TT>
><BR><TT>teaching my son the ways of our ancestors.  It was</TT>
><BR><TT>very upsetting for my son to be called a devil</TT>
><BR><TT>worshipper by other school children.</TT>
><P><TT>__________________________________________________</TT>
><BR><TT>Do You Yahoo!?</TT>
><BR><TT>>From homework help to love advice, Yahoo! Experts has your
>answer.</TT>
><BR><TT><A
>HREF="http://experts.yahoo.com/">http://experts.yahoo.com/</A></TT>
><BR> 
><P>
><BR><TT>Message boards, timely articles, a free newsletter and
>more!</TT>
><BR><TT>Check it all out at: <A
>HREF="http://www.unschooling.com">http://www.unschooling.com</A></TT>
><P><TT>Addresses:</TT>
><BR><TT>Post message: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com</TT>
><BR><TT>Unsubscribe: Unschooling-dotcom-unsubscribe@egroups.com</TT>
><BR><TT>List owner: Unschooling-dotcom-owner@egroups.com</TT>
><BR><TT>List settings page: <A
>HREF="http://www.egroups.com/group/Unschooling-dotcom">http://www.egroups.com/group/Unschooling-dotcom</A></TT>
><BR> 
><P>" In the midst of winter,I found within me an invincible summer"
>Albert
>Camus Icq number 87168064 We are courageous,we are brave,we are the
>survivors......deb
><P>
><HR noshade width="90%">Get your own FREE, personal Netscape WebMail
>account
>today at <A HREF="http://home.netscape.com/webmail"
>target="top">http://home.netscape.com/webmail</A>.</BLOCKQUOTE>
></HTML>

messages.subject: Re: [[Unschooling-dotcom] Religion and Homeschooling]
messages.msgSnippet: Me too! Thank you Debra. J.
messages.messageBody:
Me too!
Thank you Debra.
J.

Debra Caruso wrote:

I am not homeschooling for religious reasons.Although I respect others who do
so.I joined this list because of unschooling.One of the biggest reasons I have
not joined a support group in my area is because of very negative experiences
with the Christian ones.I prefer to keep the focus on unschooling ,and not
someones religious beliefs.I enjoy meeting people of all
faiths,ideas,etc......Peace...Deb in Va
 
 
 
 
 

> ---------------------------------------------
>      Attachment:
>      MIME Type: multipart/alternative
> ---------------------------------------------
I came to this list because it seemed to be on the
generic side when it came to religion.  When I first
decided to homeschool I knew it might be difficult to
find other American Indian homeschoolers.  While I
respect others religious beliefs Im glad to be on a
list that I am not inundated with being told how wrong
I am for being a "purist" or "heathen radical" and
teaching my son the ways of our ancestors.  It was
very upsetting for my son to be called a devil
worshipper by other school children.
